jobs.title: Senior ROR Developer (Back-end)
jobs.description:
About Colossus

We believe in making sports bigger by enabling sports fans to engage with the sports they love and realise their dreams through lottery-sized jackpots. We are the inventors of the award-winning Cash Out, Syndicates and FreePlay features. We develop our technology and manage risk fully in-house.

Our story in numbers: 20M bets processed, £100M payouts, 12 patents granted, 25 languages, 50 currencies, 35 countries, 50+ B2B partners.

Do you have what it takes?

Find out more at colossusbets.com and corporate.colossusbets.com


About this Role

We are looking for an experienced and highly motivated Senior Ruby on Rails (ROR) Developer to join the most ambitious sports gaming technology team in recent memory. The Back-end team has been at the forefront of our expansion, achieving feats such as integrating a new partner every 2 weeks for a continuous period of 12 months, while being key to the launch of sophisticated new features. The Senior ROR Developer will actively participate in the decision making process for ongoing core product improvements and integrate new partners, while advocating best practices for high quality code. The successful candidate will combine the mindset of a strong, disciplined individual contributor with that of a leader keen on mentoring others. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone looking to develop in a leadership capacity, while enjoying all the benefits of a high-growth and collaborative environment.


Required Skills

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science
Strong Ruby on Rails programming skills with 3+ years of experience in a business setting
Formal management experience and/or demonstrated ability to plan, delegate and lead
RESTful APIs
Databases such as MySQL
Experience with MongoDB
Experience with a messaging system (i.e. Kafka, RabbitMQ)
Management of cache system (Redis, Memcached)
Experience with working and reasoning with applications running at scale
Solid understanding of software engineering best practices (version control, code reviews, testing, refactoring, etc.)
Personal attributes

Strong organisational skills, good time management and planning
Ability to scope deliverables and set goals for others
Self-motivated and leading by example
Keen problem solver
Best practice fanatic, especially when it comes to writing clean code
